summary: This is a court order from the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, dated September 11, 2020. It directs the United States to submit an amicus brief regarding arguments raised by Ghislaine Maxwell and her motion to consolidate appeals, and adjourns a scheduled hearing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central defendant in the appeal case, who has raised arguments and filed a motion to consolidate appeals.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: Presiding judge (J.) for the case in the Southern District of New York, as indicated in the document header.

persons.name: Sharon Churcher
persons.context: Listed as a respondent in the case, indicating involvement in the legal proceedings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as a respondent in the case, posthumously involved in the legal proceedings.

persons.name: Julie Brown
persons.context: Listed as an intervenor, likely a journalist or media representative given the context of Miami Herald Media Company.

persons.name: Alan M. Dershowitz
persons.context: Listed as an intervenor, a prominent attorney involved in the case.

persons.name: Michael Cemovich
persons.context: Listed as an intervenor doing business as Cemovich Media, indicating media involvement.

persons.name: Catherine O'Hagan Wolfe
persons.context: Clerk of Court who issued the order on behalf of the court.

connections.description: Both are named parties in the same appellate case, with Maxwell as the defendant-appellant and Epstein as a respondent, indicating their legal and alleged operational connection.
Dershowitz is listed as an intervenor in Maxwell's appeal, indicating a legal interest or representation in the proceedings.
Julie Brown is listed alongside Miami Herald Media Company as intervenors, strongly suggesting she is a journalist employed by the media outlet covering the case.

events.title: Court Issues Order for Amicus Brief
events.description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit orders the United States to submit an amicus letter brief regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's arguments and her motion to consolidate appeals.

events.title: Deadline for U.S. Amicus Brief
events.description: The court-ordered deadline for the United States to submit its amicus brief.

events.title: Hearing Adjourned
events.description: A hearing scheduled for September 22, 2020, is adjourned until further order of the court.

events.title: Deadline for Party Responses
events.description: The deadline for parties to the appeal to respond to the United States' amicus brief.

locations: Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY
keyFacts: The U.S. Court of Appeals ordered the United States government to file an amicus brief regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's appellate arguments and her motion to consolidate her appeal with another case (20-3061).
A scheduled hearing for September 22, 2020, was adjourned indefinitely by the court.
Multiple intervenors, including media representatives (Julie Brown/Miami Herald, Michael Cemovich) and attorney Alan Dershowitz, are formally involved in the appellate proceedings.
The document shows ongoing, active appellate litigation in Ghislaine Maxwell's case as of September 2020.
